javadoc:
A generic functional interface that is more semantically sound than {@link Runnable}.  Use
 anywhere you wish to have a generic callback function.

methods.javadoc:
Creates a dummy callback function.  This is useful to avoid using <tt>null</tt>.
@return a dummy callback function
methods.name: dummy
methods.comment: Creates a dummy callback function.  This is useful to avoid using null.

methods.name: dummyIfNull
methods.comment:
Returns the given callback object if it is not null.  Otherwise, a #dummy() 
 callback is returned.  This is useful to avoid using null.

params.name: c
params.comment: the callback function to check for null

methods.javadoc: The method that will be called.
methods.name: call
methods.comment: The method that will be called.

name: Callback
comment:
A generic functional interface that is more semantically sound than Runnable.  Use
 anywhere you wish to have a generic callback function.
